com.example.as1

Class FoodFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.as1.FoodFrame

  • public class FoodFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Drew Kinneer The `FoodFrame` class is a helper class for displaying food items in an Android app, allowing for drag-and-drop functionality and displaying information about the food item in a dialog box.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      The "clear" function sets the "food" variable to null and sets the image resource to 0.
      Food getFood()
      The function returns a Food object.
      ImageView getFoodImage()
      The function returns an ImageView object representing a food image.
      void setFood(Food food)
      This function sets the value of the "food" variable to the input "food" object.
      void setFoodImageByUrl()
      This function sets the image of a food item by decoding an image URL and displaying it in a drawable format.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getFood

        public Food getFood()
        The function returns a Food object.
        Returns:

        The function returns an ImageView object representing a food image.

      • setFood

        public void setFood(Food food)
        This function sets the value of the "food" variable to the input "food" object.
        Parameters:
        food - The "food" parameter is an object of the class "Food". The method "setFood" sets the value of the instance variable "food" to the value passed as the parameter.

        public void clear()
        The "clear" function sets the "food" variable to null and sets the image resource to 0.

      • setFoodImageByUrl

        public void setFoodImageByUrl()
        This function sets the image of a food item by decoding an image URL and displaying it in a drawable format.
